On Sun, Aug 16, 2009 at 8:46 PM, Mike Forsberg <bigmike@...> wrote:

> T=
here should not be a whole series of
> steps that have to run in order to g=
et a single test to pass.
>
It's the right thing to do for unit tests but n=
ot for functional tests.
After all, each method of our code is heavily depe=
ndent on the way it was
invoked, so it's not surprising to see this need ar=
ise in testing such
code.  This is especially useful when the setup is conv=
oluted and
time-consuming.

Dependent testing is especially useful for web =
testing, where each page is
tested in sequence and having tests that respec=
t this dependency can save
you a lot of time and hassle.
